intro: Saccopetalum tectonum, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Saccopetalum tectonum is an important species in Hawaiian ecosystems, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
